revision.comment: Rescuing 2 sources and tagging 0 as dead. #IABot (v1.6.2)
revision.text:
{{Infobox comedian | name = Noel Murphy | image = Noel Murphy (comedian).png | caption = Noel Murphy opening for Bill Cosby, Santa Cruz Civic Center, 2010 | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1961|07|25|mf=y}} | birth_place = Grosee Point, [[Michigan]] | death_date = | death_place = | medium = [[Stand up comedian|Stand-up]], [[television]] | nationality = American | active = 1980–present | genre = | subject = | influences = | influenced = | signature = }} '''Noel Murphy''' (born July 25, 1961) is an [[United States|American]] stand-up comedian and a film director. He managed the New York Comedy Club from a failing venue to one of the top showcase clubs in [[New York City]]{{citation needed|date=January 2015}}. He currently{{when|date=January 2015}} lives in [[California]].
==Short Bio==
Born in Grosse Pointe, [[Michigan]], [[United States]] to parents John and Patricia Murphy, Murphy attended [[Hampshire Country School]], [[Harvard]] and [[The Second City|Second City]].
==Media career==
Murphy began his stand-up comedy career in the early 80's in [[Boston]] at the Ding Ho Comedy Club. His first stage appearance was at [[Harvard University]] with [[Boston]] Storyteller [[Brother Blue]] in 1971. He is the author of the book "How to Talk Funny and Influence People".<ref>http://www.noelmurphyseminars.com/products.html</ref> His show "The Noel Murphy Show" ran for 11 years on SCTV in Central Coast [[California]].<ref>http://www.noelmurphyseminars.com/about-noel.html</ref> In his stand-up comedy career he has worked professionally with [[Bill Cosby]], [[Jay Leno]], [[Paula Poundstone]], [[Bon Jovi]]. Murphy is the creator of [[Dr. Rupert Opie]]. This character is a comic and satirical reflection of pompous television self-help gurus. Murphy founded (The Doctors of Comedy) with Comedian Jeff Applebaum. This bringing volunteer stand-up comedy shows to hospitals and alcohol and drug treatment centers around the U.S. He also performed national tours such as "The Dangerous Comedy Tour" and "Unsafe At Any Speed". In 2009, he was the scriptwriter and performer for a one-man show ''Buckminster Fuller Live'', playing futurist inventor [[Buckminster Fuller]].<ref>{{cite web|author=Bucky |url=http://buckminsterfullerlive.blogspot.com/ |title=Buckminster Fuller Live |publisher=Buckminsterfullerlive.blogspot.com |date=2009-08-06 |accessdate=2012-01-21}}</ref> <ref>{{cite web |url=http://buckminsterfullerlive.com/ |publisher=Buckminsterfullerlive.com |date=2010-04-19 |accessdate=2012-01-21}}</ref>
He recently{{when?|date=February 2017}} produced his second feature film: ''[[The Last Dymaxion|The Last Dymaxion: Buckminster Fuller's Dream Restored]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://dymaxioncar.com/documentary.html |title=Dymaxion Car |publisher=Dymaxion Car |date= |accessdate=2012-01-21}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.brownpapertickets.com/event/138859 |title=Buckminster Fuller's Dream Restored... The Last Dymaxion- A screening with Filmmaker Noel Murphy |publisher=Brownpapertickets.com |date= |accessdate=2012-01-21}}</ref> The film has been written up in the New York Times prompting an October 2011 lecture and screening at [[Yale University]].<ref>{{cite news| url=https://www.nytimes.com/2011/01/14/arts/design/14antiques.html | work=The New York Times | first=Eve M. | last=Kahn | title=Dymaxion Cars, Americana Auctions and French Gilded Art | date=2011-01-13}}</ref> <ref>{{cite web |url=http://38.127.130.132/event/ef-the-last-dymaxion-buckminster-fullers-dream-restored-EID-E0-001-041945000-0.html |title=The Last Dymaxion: Buckminster Fuller’s Dream Restored |publisher=38.127.130.132 |date=2011-10-27 |accessdate=2012-01-21 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130605180448/http://38.127.130.132/event/ef-the-last-dymaxion-buckminster-fullers-dream-restored-EID-E0-001-041945000-0.html |archivedate=2013-06-05 |df= }}</ref> <ref>{{cite web |url=http://events.newstimes.com/new-haven-ct/events/show/201821646-the-last-dymaxion-buckminster-fullers-dream-restored |title=The Last Dymaxion: Buckminster Fuller's Dream Restored - Yale University - News-Times (Danbury) |publisher=Events.newstimes.com |date=2011-10-27 |accessdate=2012-01-21 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20120708014504/http://events.newstimes.com/new-haven-ct/events/show/201821646-the-last-dymaxion-buckminster-fullers-dream-restored |archivedate=2012-07-08 |df= }}</ref>
